Topic.Title: Marissa A. Mayer......1975 was the last year America had a trade surplus.

Message.Msg: Come on....people!! Only one thumbs down. You can do better than that... Maybe if you read this... ["Walmart China firmly believes in local sourcing. We have established partnerships with nearly 20,000 suppliers in China. Over 95% of the merchandise in our stores in China is sourced locally. In addition, Walmart is committed to local talent development and diversity, especially the cultivation and full utilization of female staff and executives. 99.9% of Walmart China associates are Chinese nationals. All our stores in China are managed by local Chinese. Furthermore, over 60 percent of Walmart China associates are female and about 40% of those are at management level. In 2009, the company established the “Walmart China Women’s Leadership Development Commission” for driving women’s career development."] Yeap! that be on Wal*Mart's China website under "About Us." less than 5% foreign in all Wal*Mart stores in China... oh! and their Global Procurement Office is in China too... and Marissa Ann sits on their Board... WHY? oh! she was there first... before she was here... duh!

Message.Msg: Grey- I KNEW when they pulled him with about 5-6mins left against St. Louis that with Houston and Green Bay up it'd be tough. I must admit that was some of the best football I've ever seen. Bombs by both Ponder and Rodgers, AP getting to the secondary and if Frazier called one of the two timeouts he could have attempted those 9 more yds. If not for those couple lost runs he probably would have been within a yard or two. I would have loved to see the record as that is a once-in-a-lifetime thing whereas the playoffs is yearly, we ain't winning the SB. You know what's HUGE???? Its the fact Blair Walsh can kick from anywhere(10 of 50+yds) and Mason Crosby can't hit the broad side of a barn this year. In the playoffs, field goals are everything...Patriots dynasty got their SB's from them and Belicheck cheating.haha I just hope AP runs for ANOTHER 200yds. and Winfield with broken hand keeps Rodgers in check.

Message.Title: An indication where it's headed
Message.Msg: Wooohooo! new message board format!!! I mean the old one hadn't changed significantly (that I could tell) since 1999 and that's no joke. The message boards were a symptom of the rest of the place, Yahoo has been ossified, literally, for that long. Finally, finally things are about to change. Hey Marisa hire somebody that really understands finance and really bring Yahoo Finance back to the glory days when it was doing 100 million page view/day. Start by cleaning up the abomination that is the classic/new charts it's hideous. At least KJS got that right over at G Finance. Also, can't anyone figure out that there are weekly options, I mean holy #$%$, the options could be so good with just a bit of work. And please please, it would be really nice to give us a tiny peak at greeks, how about delta and implieds to start?

Message.Title: YAHOO in 2013 . . .
